    • Constructor Detail

      • BinaryInputSplit

        public BinaryInputSplit(int num,
                        Path file,
                        long start,
                        long length,
                        java.lang.String[] hosts)
        Constructs a split with host information.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of this input split
        file - the file name
        start - the position of the first byte in the file to process
        length - the number of bytes in the file to process (-1 is flag for "read whole file")
        hosts - the list of hosts containing the block, possibly null

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the given input split. This method opens the input stream to the specified file, allocates read buffers and positions the stream at the correct position, making sure that any partial record at the beginning is skipped.
        Specified by:
        open in interface InputSplit<byte[]>
        Overrides:
        open in class FileInputSplit<byte[]>
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the spit could not be opened due to an I/O problem.

      • reachedEnd

        public boolean reachedEnd()
        Description copied from interface: InputSplit
        Method used to check if the end of the input is reached.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Returns:
        True if the end is reached, otherwise false.

      • nextRecord

        public byte[] nextRecord(byte[] record)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: InputSplit
        Reads the next record from the input.

        When this method is called, the input format it guaranteed to be opened.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if an I/O error occurred.
